Text: Oh...
Heehee, there we are.

It seems a bit stupid to keep such detailed records,
doesn't it... Hm?
(These are...activity records for the Templars!)

(Does this actually show the place, time, and people
involved in the Cult's gathering of the possessed?!)
(They even have future entries... Woah!)
"Under investigation?"

(That sounds like an external action. Like they're
investigating a third party's plans.)
Oh?!

(It really looks like the Cult and Templars are
working completely independently.)

(If the Templars are keeping their distance from the
Cult...they could be fighting over the possessed
somehow.)

(It wouldn't be at all odd if someone was killed for
witnessing something, like the other day.)

(This schedule indicates they're gathering Cult intel
to get to the possessed before the Cult does...)

If that's the case, then there must be records
about encounters in the Sacred Land.

(There! Rather than taking the possessed to the
Cult's hideout in the Sacred Land, it seems that
they demanded they be handed over.)
(Beta and I stumbled onto this purely by accident.)

This reference to another document appended here
is relatively newâ€¦

(It refers to "a mysterious interfering organization",
which must be the Shadow Garden.)
Heh...

(They haven't written any concrete plans for dealing
with us yet.)

(Well, conflict with the Templars was inevitable,
so this is all really just basic policy.)
These documents all seem much older...
Huh?!
(This is labeled as the Possession Inquisition Act!)

(This is no inquisition! What they're describing here
are ways to execute the possessed! Those monsters!)

(Well, I guess this is just more proof that the
Templars and Cult are on different paths.)

(The Cult is gathering up the possessed for some
kind of experiments, but this...)

(The Templars are executing the possessed on
sight as heretics against the Goddess.)

(Hold on... The Cult is gathering up the possessed
with the Church's cooperation.)

(They're working together to bring the possessed to
the nearest church, and then they're never seen again.)

(So then, why is the Church's own group, the
Templars, taking the Cult's targets first?)
(I guess we'll need to keep investigating.)

(I guess different parts of really big organizations
have their own ideas and objectives.)

(From the outside, what I see is the Templars,
under Church authority, in conflict with the
Cult, who are working with the Church.)
(I guess this room was made for the Inquisition.)

(So, it's not a place for shady business with big
shots, it's a place to brand them as heretics.)
(With that hidden passage, it's the perfect spot.)
If that's the case, there's something off here.

(The scent of blood is so strong it cuts through the
perfumed oil, but there's no stink of rotting flesh.
No smell of death.)
(You'd expect such a place to show signs of death.)

(You can't expect negotiations with uncooperative
big shots to always end peacefully.)
So, that's how it is...
Few guards working around plenty of detection traps.

They're masking the scent of blood, but there's no
trace or smell of death.

An evil spirit bound by magical chains and kept
under complete control.

That kind of setup could make heretics and intruders
alike vanish without a trace.

If the devout knew what the Church was up to, every
one of them would give up their faith on the spot.
An intruder?! Th-That's never happened before!

Ha! Brave but foolish to sneak in here. Capture her!
Kill her if you have to!

Calling for backup, I see. You certainly don't play
nice for a supposed holy group.
Well, I suppose I'll just be heading home.
